Introduction

The aims of this report is to discuss 2 of the most popular transportation methods used by students. The report will introduce the methods of transportations and analyze their advantages and disadvantages. The report will conclude by providing recommendations to the university regarding these methods of transportation.

Most Popular Transport:

The most popular transport method used by students is the bike. Students prefer this means of transportation for many reasons. Firstly, using a bike is very cheap, which is necessary for students as they are on limited budgets, especially international students. Therefore, using a bike would save students a lot of money. Secondly, biking is a form of exercise, and thus using the bike daily to commute to and from the university will help students exercises and stay healthy and in shape. Thirdly, bikes do not emit any gases, because they do not use fuel as a source of energy, and thus using bikes is good for the environment as it does not pollute the environment.

On the other hand, there are some disadvantages associated with using a bike, firstly it is difficult to find a parking spot for the bike and this creates other problems like risking having the bike stolen. In addition, while using a bike is cheap and environmentally friendly, it is a slow mode of transportation, and not convenient for long distances. Finally, since biking is a form of exercise, student usually sweat after biking, and therefore they need to change their clothes, which could be very inconvenient.

Second Most Popular Transport:


The second most popular mode of transportation used by students is the train. The train offers many advantages to students, firstly it is a quick mode of transportation. Trains are very fast and could get students around the city in a matter of minutes. In addition, trains are environmentally friendly, as they run on electricity and do not emit any gases like cars of buses. Finally, students find it convenient to use trains because stations are located near the university, and thus it is easy for students to catch trains.

One of the main disadvantages of trains is the expensive train tickets, especially for students as they are on a limited budget as mentioned previously. In addition, trains are often late or sometimes even canceled, which could cause problems for students such as being late to class/home or even getting stuck at the university for a period of time if a train is canceled. Finally, trains are usually very crowded during rush hours, which makes it uncomfortable mode of transportation for students, as they have to get pushed around inside the train.

 

Recommendations:

The modes of transportation discussed above both have their advantages and disadvantages, however there are some recommendations which could be taken into consideration by the university to improve the efficiency of these methods. Firstly, regarding bikes, it is important to develop safe spots and zones for students to park their bikes and not worry about them. In addition, it would also be good if the university offers changing rooms for students who need to change upon arrival to university. In addition, since it is the preferred and most convenient mode of transportation for students, the university could offer to rent bikes to its students on an annual basis, since some cannot afford them.

Regarding the trains, the university could push the start times for classes in order to avoid rush hour and thus students would be more comfortable using the trains. Moreover, the university could work on a student card or pass with the local authorities to provide students with discounted tickets to use the train.
